fields.title: Castile Soap
fields.description: This is a basic soap using 100% Olive Oil. Thought to have originated in the Castile region of Spain, this soap is a staple in many soapers' recipe books.
fields.notes: Castile soaps can take longer to trace, and longer to cure. It is advised to let the bars cure for 6-12 months to ensure a hard bar. Adding sodium lactate to the lye solution is recommended as well.

fields.title: Coconut Oil Soap
fields.description: This recipe is made from 100% Coconut Oil.
fields.notes: Although Coconut Oil can be drying, superfatting at 20% can offset the natural tendencies to create a simple to make bar. This bar creates tons of bubbles!

fields.title: Basic Beginner's Recipe
fields.description: This is a very basic recipe that uses the 3 most used oils in soapmaking, plus Castor Oil for extra bubbles and lather stability.
fields.notes: This recipe is a must have in your recipe book. Many recipes are variations on this one.
